item.title: Michelle add a quote by Michael Cox
item.description: "I had retained little of what is generally called religion, except for a visceral conviction that our lives are controlled by some universal mechanism that is greater than ourselves. Perhaps that was what others called God. Perhaps not." -- Michael Cox

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Cox, Michael
item.description: "For Death is the meaning of night; The eternal shadow Into which all lives must fall, All hopes expire." -- Cox, Michael

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Michael Cox
item.description: "After killing the red-haired man, I took myself off to Quinn’s for an oyster supper." -- Michael Cox

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Elizabeth Lowell
item.description: "Love is the light that casts no shadow." -- Elizabeth Lowell

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "One is loved because one is loved. No reason is needed for loving." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "We can never judge the lives of others, because each person knows only their own pain and renunciation. It's one thing to feel that you are on the right path, but it's another to think that yours is the only path." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Anyone who has lost something they thought was theirs forever finally comes to realise that nothing really belongs to them." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Anyone who loves in the expectation of being loved in return is wasting their time." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Tell your heart that the fear of suffering is worse than the suffering itself. And that no heart has ever suffered when it goes in search of its dreams, because every second of the search is a second's encounter with God and with eternity." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "I ached once, hard, like a period typed at the end of a sentence." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "Sometimes I think illness sits inside every woman, waiting for the right moment to bloom. I have known so many sick women all my life. Women with chronic pain, with ever-gestating diseases. Women with conditions. Men, sure, they have bone snaps, they have backaches, they have a surgery or two, yank out a tonsil, insert a shiny plastic hip. Women get consumed." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "I am, I guess, depressed. I guess I've been depressed for about twenty-four years. I can feel a better version of me somewhere in there - hidden behind a liver or attached to a bit of spleen within my stunted, childish body - a Libby that's telling me to get up, do something, grow up, move on. But the meanness usually wins out. (2)" -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "I have a meanness inside me, real as an organ. Slit me at my belly and it might slide out, meaty and dark, drop on the floor so you could stomp on it." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "and now, all these years later, it seem to him that the most horrible fact of human existence was that broken hearts mended" -- Stephen King

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Mario Vargas Llosa
item.description: "One can't fight with oneself, for this battle has only one loser." -- Mario Vargas Llosa

item.title: Michelle add a quote by W.B. Yeats
item.description: "When you are old and grey and full of sleep And nodding by the fire, take down this book, And slowly read, and dream of the soft look Your eyes had once, and of their shadows deep" -- W.B. Yeats

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "You may tell a tale that takes up residence in someone's soul, becomes their blood and self and purpose. That tale will move them and drive them and who knows that they might do because of it, because of your words. That is your role, your gift." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "Secrets have power. And that power diminishes when they are shared, so they are best kept and kept well. Sharing secrets, real secrets, important ones, with even one other person, will change them. Writing them down is worse, because who can tell how many eyes might see them inscribed on paper, no matter how careful you might be with it. So it's really best to keep your secrets when you have them, for their own good, as well as yours." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "The finest of pleasures are always the unexpected ones." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I have never listened to anyone who criticized my taste in space travel, sideshows or gorillas. When this occurs, I pack up my dinosaurs and leave the room." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "If we listened to our intellect we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go in business because we'd be cynical: "It's gonna go wrong." Or "She's going to hurt me." Or,"I've had a couple of bad love affairs, so therefore . . ." Well, that's nonsense. You're going to miss life. You've got to jump off the cliff all the time and build your wings on the way down." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must write every single day of your life... You must lurk in libraries and climb the stacks like ladders to sniff books like perfumes and wear books like hats upon your crazy heads... may you be in love every day for the next 20,000 days. And out of that love, remake a world." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Brian Jacques
item.description: "Don't be ashamed to weep; 'tis right to grieve. Tears are only water, and flowers, trees, and fruit cannot grow without water. But there must be sunlight also. A wounded heart will heal in time, and when it does, the memory and love of our lost ones is sealed inside to comfort us." -- Brian Jacques

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Brian Jacques
item.description:
"Even the strongest and bravest must sometimes weep. It shows they have a great heart, one that can feel compassion for others."
—Cornflower" -- Brian Jacques
